rev.comment: most ubuntu-based distros are not forks on the strict sense of the word

Line 169: Line 169:
*[[Ubuntu Netbook Remix]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.cnet.com/8301-13580_3-9950552-39.html |title=Ubuntu to announce its mobile Linux in June |accessdate=2008-08-19}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ubuntu.com/news/netbook-remix |title=Ubuntu Netbook Remix |accessdate=2008-06-10}}</ref> designed for netbooks and other ultra-portables.
*[[Ubuntu Netbook Remix]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.cnet.com/8301-13580_3-9950552-39.html |title=Ubuntu to announce its mobile Linux in June |accessdate=2008-08-19}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ubuntu.com/news/netbook-remix |title=Ubuntu Netbook Remix |accessdate=2008-06-10}}</ref> designed for netbooks and other ultra-portables.
â
There are also many [[List_of_Linux_distributions#Ubuntu-based|unofficial variants, unsponsored derivatives, and other localizations and customizations]] not controlled or guided by [[Canonical Ltd.|Canonical]], which are generally [[fork (software development)|fork]] customizations that have been created for specific goals.
+
There are also many [[List_of_Linux_distributions#Ubuntu-based|unofficial variants, unsponsored derivatives, and other localizations and customizations]] not controlled or guided by [[Canonical Ltd.|Canonical]], which generally contain customizations that have been created for specific goals.
